meanings.definition: To exclaim in amazement or relief.
meanings.sent1: She aahed when she saw the surprise party decorations.
meanings.sent2: The crowd aahed in awe as the magician performed his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The puppy aahed happily when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks display aahed in the night sky, mesmerizing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The children aahed with delight as they opened their presents.

meanings.definition: The act of exclaiming in amazement or relief.
meanings.sent1: The sudden aahed of the audience filled the theater.
meanings.sent2: His loud aahed echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The baby's aahed was music to their ears.
meanings.sent4: The collective aahed of the crowd could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's aahed of approval made the students proud.
